Interesting.  Isn't the client allowed to stipulate what the identifier of =
a
new resource is allowed to be? If this is true then POST/cache/1 should b=
e
allowed with the appropriate error returned if is already exists.
To your=
 point it could also be modeled with the server creating the
identifier, wh=
ich would add the expectation that the resource identifier is
returned in t=
he response.

Regards,

Bediako

ilkov <stefan.tilkov@...>wrote:
